cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles (25 km) south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest then north-northwest and track across the central and north-west Gulf of Mexico toward the Texas–Louisiana border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-western Gulf Coast near the TX/LA border (Cameron LA–Port Arthur TX area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect yet; hurricane and storm-surge watches expected later for northwest Gulf coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-west Gulf coastline from central Louisiana westward to upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (up to 56% chance) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; hurricane-force winds possible if Laura strengthens as forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for 3–6 ft or higher surge along south-central Louisiana coast near and east of the landfall point.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated amounts to 12 inches Wednesday–Friday, creating flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf/rip currents beginning mid-week; isolated tornadoes possible inland during and after landfall.
